item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "Gradually the healing took place, seeming as it always does that it wasn't taking place." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "What a strange thing! to be alive beneath cherry blossoms." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Failing to fetch me at first, keep encouraged. Missing me one place, search another. I stop somewhere waiting for you." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "for it was not knowledge but unity that she desired, not inscriptions on tablets, nothing that could be written in any language known to men, but intimacy itself, which is knowledge" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Issa Kobayashi
item.description: "The world of dew is the world of dew. And yet, and yet--" -- Issa Kobayashi

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "From that time forth he believed that the wise man is one who never sets himself apart from other living things, whether they have speech or not, and in later years he strove long to learn what can be learned, in silence, from the eyes of animals, the flight of birds, the great slow gestures of trees." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "All the time I pray to Buddha I keep on killing mosquitoes." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Boethius
item.description:
"Nunc fluens facit tempus, nunc stans facit aeternitatum.
(The now that passes produces time, the now that remains produces eternity.)" -- Boethius

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Why, if it was an illusion, not praise the catastrophe, whatever it was, that destroyed illusion and put truth in it's place?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "O snail Climb Mount Fuji But slowly, slowly!" -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "Where there are humans, You'll find flies, And Buddhas." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "Never forget: we walk on hell, gazing at flowers." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "Freedom is a heavy load, a great and strange burden for the spirit to undertake. It is not easy. It is not a gift given, but a choice made, and the choice may be a hard one. The road goes upward towards the light; but the laden traveler may never reach the end of it." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description:
"Only in silence the word, Only in dark the light, Only in dying life: Bright the hawk's flight On the empty sky.
<i>—The Creation of Éa</i>" -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Light is the left hand of darkness and darkness the right hand of light. Two are one, life and death, lying together like lovers in kemmer, like hands joined together, like the end and the way." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "To learn which questions are unanswerable, and <i>not to answer them</i>: this skill is most needful in times of stress and darkness." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "I use a whole lot of half-assed semicolons; there was one of them just now; that was a semicolon after 'semicolons,' and another one after 'now." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "To hear, one must be silent." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Night falls; the traveler must pass down village streets, between the houses with yellow- lit windows, and on out into the darkness of the fields. Each alone, they go west or north, towards the mountains. They go on. They leave Omelas, they walk ahead into the darkness, and they do not come back. The place they go towards is a place even less imaginable to most of us than the city of happiness. I cannot describe it at all. It is possible that it does not exist. But they seem to know where they are going, the ones who walk away from Omelas." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Lao-Tzu
item.description:
"Stop thinking, and end your problems. What difference between yes and no? What difference between success and failure? Must you value what others value, avoid what others avoid? How ridiculous!
Other people are excited, as though they were at a parade. I alone don't care, I alone am expressionless, like an infant before it can smile.
Other people have what they need; I alone possess nothing. I alone drift about, like someone without a home. I am like an idiot, my mind is so empty.
Other people are bright; I alone am dark. Other people are sharp; I alone am dull. Other people have purpose; I alone don't know. I drift like a wave on the ocean, I blow as aimless as the wind.
I am different from ordinary people. I drink from the Great Mother's breasts." -- Lao-Tzu

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Tao Te-Ching
item.description:
"Empty your mind of all thoughts. Let your heart be at peace. Watch the turmoil of beings, but contemplate their return.
Each separate being in the universe returns to the common source. Returning to the source is serenity.
If you don't realize the source, you stumble in confusion and sorrow. When you realize where you come from, you naturally become tolerant, disinterested, amused, kindhearted as a grandmother, dignified as a king. Immersed in the wonder of the Tao, you can deal with whatever life brings you, and when death comes, you are ready." -- Tao Te-Ching

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Fill your bowl to the brim and it will spill. Keep sharpening your knife and it will blunt." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty" - Lao-tsu" -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Creighton add a quote by Lao Tzu (Lao Tse)
item.description: "Darkness within darkness. The gateway to all understanding " -- Lao Tzu (Lao Tse)
